title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Takeaways from Trump's address. And, some GOP lawmakers shift stance on ACA subsidies

items.title: RFK Jr. and Dr. Oz to announce moves to ban gender-affirming care for young people
items.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is expected to announce a package of measures that would together ban gender-affirming care for minors. A press...

items.title: A new 'Avatar,' a marital stand-up story and a gut-wrenching drama are in theaters
items.description: A new drama uses the real, gut-wrenching recordings of a call for help from Gaza to tell a harrowing and profound story.

items.title: New York has a new Archbishop. His background looks a lot like Pope Leo's
items.description: Like Pope Leo, Bishop Ronald Hicks is an Illinois native with deep experience in Latin America.

items.title: Could international troops be sent to Gaza? Here's why Trump's plan hinges on it
items.description: President Trump's peace plan for Gaza hinges on international troops in Gaza, but Israel is skeptical and no country has yet agreed to send their sold...

items.title: An early look at our town hall and debate series, launching in 2026
items.description: "Things That Matter," a series of planned town halls and debates sponsored by Bank of America, will launch early next year.

items.title: Rebels start to withdraw from key DR Congo city, leaders say
items.description: DR Congo's government say the announced withdrawal is intended to distract the US mediation team.

items.title: Pope Leo taps Bishop Ronald Hicks to succeed Cardinal Dolan
items.description: Pope Leo XIV has named Bishop Ronald Hicks of Joliet, Illinois, to succeed retiring Timothy Cardinal Dolan as archbishop of New York.

items.title: Nigeria apologises over Burkina Faso military flight that saw 11 servicemen detained
items.description: The air force personnel have been released but have not yet returned home, Nigeria says.

items.title: CBS News and The Free Press launch town hall and debate series
items.description: "Things That Matter," a series of planned town halls and debates sponsored by Bank of America, will launch early next year.

items.title: French 'Doctor Death' who poisoned patients jailed for life
items.description: A court finds Frédéric Péchier guilty of contaminating infusion bags with substances that caused cardiac arrest or hemorrhaging.

items.title: Bit by bit, small US groups chip away at historic levels of social isolation

items.title: Trump Media to merge with fusion energy company TAE in $6 billion deal
items.description: President Trump's media company is joining forces with a company working to commercialize fusion energy.

items.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders start crunch talks on Russia's frozen cash
items.description: The leaders are deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros in frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

items.title: Thailand bombs near Cambodia's Poipet border crossing
items.description: The bombings come as renewed border clashes show no sign of letting up between the two countries.

items.title: China fumes as White House announces record $10B in arms sales to Taiwan
items.description: The Trump administration's announcement of plan to sell Taiwan a record $10 billion worth of weapons draws an angry response from China.

items.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent Peter Arnett, who reported on Vietnam and Gulf wars, has died
